title: Authors and Citation
text: Janssenswillen G (2025). bupaR: Business Process Analysis R. R package version 1.0.0, https://bupar.net/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {bupaR: Business Process Analysis in R},   author = {Gert Janssenswillen},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://bupar.net/}, }

title: Business Process Analysis in R
text: bupaR open-source suite handling analysis business process data R developed Business Informatics research group Hasselt University, Belgium. builds upon concept event log logbook events happened recorded within execution business process. Read

title: Business Process Analysis in R
text: can install bupaR CRAN :
code: install.packages("bupaR")

title: Business Process Analysis in R
text: can install development version bupaR GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("bupaverse/bupaR")

title: Business Process Analysis in R
text: bupaR Documentation website contains details getting started Business Process Analysis using bupaR.
code: library(bupaR) #>  #> Attaching package: 'bupaR' #> The following object is masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter #> The following object is masked from 'package:utils': #>  #>     timestamp library(eventdataR)  # Get a list of all cases in the patients event log: patients %>%   cases() #> # A tibble: 500 × 10 #>   patient trace_length number_of_activities start_timestamp     #>   <chr>          <int>                <int> <dttm>              #> 1 1                  6                    6 2017-01-02 11:41:53 #> 2 10                 5                    5 2017-01-06 05:58:54 #> 3 100                5                    5 2017-04-11 16:34:31 #> 4 101                5                    5 2017-04-16 06:38:58 #> 5 102                5                    5 2017-04-16 06:38:58 #> # ℹ 495 more rows #> # ℹ 6 more variables: complete_timestamp <dttm>, trace <chr>, trace_id <dbl>, #> #   duration <drtn>, first_activity <fct>, last_activity <fct>

what: Collapse activity labels of a sub process into a single activity — act_collapse
title: Collapse activity labels of a sub process into a single activity — act_collapse
text: Collapse activity labels sub process single activity

title: Collapse activity labels of a sub process into a single activity — act_collapse
code: act_collapse(log, ..., method)  # S3 method for class 'eventlog' act_collapse(log, ..., method = c("entry_points", "consecutive"))  # S3 method for class 'activitylog' act_collapse(log, ..., method = c("entry_points", "consecutive"))  # S3 method for class 'grouped_log' act_collapse(log, ..., method = c("entry_points", "consecutive"))

title: Collapse activity labels of a sub process into a single activity — act_collapse
text: log log: Object class log derivatives (grouped_log, eventlog, activitylog, etc.). ... series named character vectors. activity labels vector collapsed one activity name vector. method Defines activities collapsed: "entry_points" heuristically learns specified activities occur start end subprocess collapses accordingly. "consecutive" collapses consecutive sequences activities.

title: Collapse activity labels of a sub process into a single activity — act_collapse
text: different strategies collapse activity labels (argument ´method´). "entry_points" method aims learn start end activities sub process, looking first last activity case whole log. Subsequently, create new instance sub process time end activity followed start activity. strategy take account activities happening mean time. "consecutive" method create instance time new sequence sub activities started. strategy thus take account interruptions activity labels.

title: Collapse activity labels of a sub process into a single activity — act_collapse
text: act_collapse(eventlog): Collapse activity labels subprocess single activity act_collapse(activitylog): Collapse activity labels subprocess single activity act_collapse(grouped_log): Collapse activity labels subprocess single activity

title: Recode activity labels — act_recode

what: Create event log from list of activity instances — activities_to_eventlog
title: Create event log from list of activity instances — activities_to_eventlog
text: function superseded. new code recommend using activitylog() create activitylog, needed to_eventlog() transform eventlog.

title: Create event log from list of activity instances — activities_to_eventlog
code: activities_to_eventlog(   activity_log,   case_id,   activity_id,   resource_id,   timestamps,   order = "auto" )

title: Create event log from list of activity instances — activities_to_eventlog
text: activity_log data.frame row activity instances case_id Column name case identifier activity_id Column name activity identifier resource_id Column name resource identifier timestamps vector column names containing different timestamp. column names transformed lifecycle identifiers order Configure handle sort events equal timestamps: auto use order original data, alphabetical sort activity labels alphabet, sorted assume data frame already correctly sorted column '.order', providing column name use column ordering (can numeric character). latter never overrule timestamp orderings.

title: Create activity log — activitylog
text: Create activity log

title: Create activity log — activitylog
code: activitylog(activitylog, case_id, activity_id, resource_id, timestamps, order)

title: Create activity log — activitylog
text: activitylog data object used activity log. can data.frame tibble. case_id case classifier activity log. character vector containing variable names length 1 . activity_id activity classifier activity log. character vector containing variable names length 1 . resource_id resource identifier activity log. character vector containing variable names length 1 . timestamps columns timestamps refering different lifecycle events. character vector 1 . one following names: "schedule","assign","reassign","start","suspend","resume","abort_activity","abort_case","complete","manualskip","autoskip". columns Date POSIXct class. order Configure handle sort events equal timestamps: auto use order original data, alphabetical sort activity labels alphabet, sorted assume data frame already correctly sorted column '.order', providing column name use column ordering (can numeric character). latter never overrule timestamp orderings.

code: add_end_activity(log, label = "End")  add_start_activity(log, label = "Start")  # S3 method for class 'eventlog' add_end_activity(log, label = "End")  # S3 method for class 'activitylog' add_end_activity(log, label = "End")  # S3 method for class 'grouped_log' add_end_activity(log, label = "End")  # S3 method for class 'eventlog' add_start_activity(log, label = "Start")  # S3 method for class 'activitylog' add_start_activity(log, label = "Start")  # S3 method for class 'grouped_log' add_start_activity(log, label = "Start")

title: Add Artificial Start/End Activities — add_end_activity
text: log log: Object class log derivatives (grouped_log, eventlog, activitylog, etc.). label character: Start (default "Start") end (default "End") activity label. must activity label already present log.

title: Add Artificial Start/End Activities — add_end_activity
text: add_end_activity(eventlog): Adds end activity eventlog. add_end_activity(activitylog): Adds end activity activitylog. add_end_activity(grouped_log): Adds end activity grouped_log.

title: Add Artificial Start/End Activities — add_end_activity
text: add_start_activity(eventlog): Adds start activity eventlog. add_start_activity(activitylog): Adds start activity activitylog. add_start_activity(grouped_log): Adds start activity grouped_log.

what: bupaR - Business Process Analysis in R — bupaR
title: bupaR - Business Process Analysis in R — bupaR
text: Functionalities process analysis R. packages implements S3-class event log objects, related handler functions. Imports related packages subsetting event data, computation descriptive statistics, handling Petri Net objects visualization process maps.

Can NULL variable: NULL (default), counts number rows group. variable, computes sum(wt) group. sort TRUE, show largest groups top. name name new column output. omitted, default n. already column called n, use nn. column called n nn, 'll use nnn, , adding ns gets new name.

title: Durations — durations
text: Computes throughput times case. Throughput time defined interval start first event completion last event.

title: Durations — durations
code: durations(log, units = c("auto", "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks"))

title: Durations — durations
text: log log: Object class log derivatives (grouped_log, eventlog, activitylog, etc.). units character (default "auto"): time unit throughput times reported. one following values: "auto" (default), "secs", "mins", "hours", "days", "weeks". See also units argument difftime.

title: Eventlog — eventlog
text: function instantiate object class eventlog specifying data.frame tibble appropriate case, activity timestamp classifiers.

title: Eventlog — eventlog
code: eventlog(   eventlog,   case_id,   activity_id,   activity_instance_id,   lifecycle_id,   timestamp,   resource_id,   order,   validate )  ieventlog(eventlog)

title: Eventlog — eventlog
text: eventlog data object used event log. can data.frame tibble. case_id case classifier event log. character vector containing variable names length 1 . activity_id activity classifier event log. character vector containing variable names length 1 . activity_instance_id activity instance classifier event log. lifecycle_id life cycle classifier event log. timestamp timestamp event log. refer Date POSIXct field. resource_id resource identifier event log. character vector containing variable names length 1 . order Configure handle sort events equal timestamps: auto use order original data, alphabetical sort activity labels alphabet, sorted assume data frame already correctly sorted column '.order', providing column name use column ordering (can numeric character). latter never overrule timestamp orderings. validate TRUE basic checks run contents event log activity instances connected one case activity. Using FALSE improves performance skipping checks.

title: Eventlog — eventlog
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data <- data.frame(case = rep("A",5), activity_id = c("A","B","C","D","E"), activity_instance_id = 1:5, lifecycle_id = rep("complete",5), timestamp = 1:5, resource = rep("resource 1", 5)) eventlog(data,case_id = "case", activity_id = "activity_id", activity_instance_id = "activity_instance_id", lifecycle_id = "lifecycle_id", timestamp = "timestamp", resource_id = "resource") } # }

title: Test if the Object is a Log — is.log
text: .log returns TRUE object inherits log class, otherwise FALSE. .eventlog returns TRUE object inherits eventlog class, otherwise FALSE. .actvitylog returns TRUE object inherits activitylog class, otherwise FALSE. .grouped_log returns TRUE object inherits grouped_log class, otherwise FALSE. .grouped_eventlog returns TRUE object inherits grouped_eventlog class, otherwise FALSE. .grouped_activitylog returns TRUE object inherits grouped_activitylog class, otherwise FALSE.

title: bupaR color scales — scale_fill_discrete_bupaR
text: bupaR color scales

title: bupaR color scales — scale_fill_discrete_bupaR
code: scale_fill_discrete_bupaR(   guide = "legend",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver() )  scale_color_discrete_bupaR(   guide = "legend",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver() )  scale_fill_continuous_bupaR(   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver(),   palette = c("green", "orange") )  scale_color_continuous_bupaR(   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver() )  scale_fill_gradient_bupaR(   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver() )  scale_color_gradient_bupaR(   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver() )  scale_fill_gradient2_bupaR(   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver(),   midpoint = 0 )  scale_color_gradient2_bupaR(   guide = "colourbar",   na.value = "grey50",   name = waiver(),   midpoint = 0 )

title: bupaR color scales — scale_fill_discrete_bupaR
text: guide Type legend. Use "colourbar" continuous colour bar, "legend" discrete colour legend. na.value Colour use missing values name name scale. Used axis legend title. waiver(), default, name scale taken first mapping used aesthetic. NULL, legend title omitted. palette Color palette used scale_._continuous_bupaR. Can "green" (default) "orange". midpoint midpoint (data value) diverging scale. Defaults 0.

title: Simple Eventlog — simple_eventlog
text: function instantiate object class eventlog specifying data.frame tibble minimally required case identifier, activity identifier timestamp. function superseded introduction activitylog format. Eventlogs 'simple' format can seen log activities, created activitylog(). required, resulting activity log can transformed back eventlog format using to_eventlog.

title: Simple Eventlog — simple_eventlog
code: simple_eventlog(   eventlog,   case_id = NULL,   activity_id = NULL,   timestamp = NULL,   resource_id = NULL,   order = "auto",   return_type = c("eventlog", "activitylog") )  isimple_eventlog(eventlog)

title: Simple Eventlog — simple_eventlog
text: eventlog data object used event log. can data.frame tibble. case_id case classifier event log. activity_id activity classifier event log. timestamp timestamp event log. resource_id resource classifier event log (optional). order Configure handle sort events equal timestamps: auto use order original data, alphabetical sort activity labels alphabet, sorted assume data frame already correctly sorted column '.order', providing column name use column ordering (can numeric character). latter never overrule timestamp orderings. return_type Whether return eventlog (default) activitylog object.

title: Simple Eventlog — simple_eventlog
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ data <- data.frame(case = rep("A",5), activity_id = c("A","B","C","D","E"), timestamp = date_decimal(1:5)) simple_eventlog(data,case_id = "case", activity_id = "activity_id", timestamp = "timestamp") } # }

title: Sample function for logs — slice_sample
code: slice_sample(.data, ..., n, prop, by = NULL, weight_by = NULL, replace = FALSE)  # S3 method for class 'log' slice_sample(.data, ..., n, prop, weight_by = NULL, replace = FALSE)  # S3 method for class 'grouped_log' slice_sample(.data, ..., n, prop, weight_by = NULL, replace = FALSE)

title: Sample function for logs — slice_sample
text: .data data frame, data frame extension (e.g. tibble), lazy data frame (e.g. dbplyr dtplyr). See Methods, , details. ... Arguments passed dplyr::slice_sample n,prop Provide either n, number rows, prop, proportion rows select. neither supplied, n = 1 used. n greater number rows group (prop > 1), result silently truncated group size. prop rounded towards zero generate integer number rows. negative value n prop subtracted group size. example, n = -2 group 5 rows select 5 - 2 = 3 rows; prop = -0.25 8 rows select 8 * (1 - 0.25) = 6 rows. n, prop Provide either n, number rows, prop, proportion rows select. neither supplied, n = 1 used. n greater number rows group (prop > 1), result silently truncated group size. prop rounded towards zero generate integer number rows. negative value n prop subtracted group size. example, n = -2 group 5 rows select 5 - 2 = 3 rows; prop = -0.25 8 rows select 8 * (1 - 0.25) = 6 rows.  <tidy-select> Optionally, selection columns group just operation, functioning alternative group_by(). details examples, see ?dplyr_by. weight_by <data-masking> Sampling weights. must evaluate vector non-negative numbers length input. Weights automatically standardised sum 1. replace sampling performed (TRUE) without (FALSE, default) replacement.

title: Sample function for logs — slice_sample
text: slice_sample(log): Sample n cases log. slice_sample(grouped_log): Sample n cases grouped_log.

title: Summarize event log — summarize
code: summarise(.data, ..., .by = NULL, .groups = NULL)

title: Summarize event log — summarize
text: .data log: Object class eventlog activitylog ... Name-value pairs summary functions . <tidy-select> Optionally, selection columns group just operation, functioning alternative group_by(). details examples, see ?dplyr_by. .groups Grouping structure result. "drop_last": dropping last level grouping. supported option version 1.0.0. "drop": levels grouping dropped. "keep": grouping structure .data. "rowwise": row group. .groups specified, chosen based number rows results: results 1 row, get "drop_last". number rows varies, get "keep" (note returning variable number rows deprecated favor reframe(), also unconditionally drops levels grouping). addition, message informs choice, unless result ungrouped, option "dplyr.summarise.inform" set FALSE, summarise() called function package.

title: Unite multiple columns into one. — unite
text: data Eventlog col name new column, string symbol. argument passed expression supports quasiquotation (can unquote strings symbols). name captured expression rlang::ensym() (note kind interface symbols represent actual objects now discouraged tidyverse; support backward compatibility). ... Additional arguments passed tidyr sep Separator use values. remove TRUE, remove input columns output data frame. na.rm TRUE, missing values removed prior uniting value.

title: bupaR 0.5.3
text: CRAN release: 2023-04-02

title: bupaR 0.5.3
text: Added new rename method, similar dplyr’s rename, automatically changes mapping log rename concerns mapping variables. Added new count method, increase compatibility dplyr. count automatically convert log object tibble.

title: bupaR 0.5.3
text: group_by(.data, ..., .add = F) now works correctly grouped_eventlog. Previously, applying group_by() grouped_eventlog reverted data.frame, prevented application bupaR functions returned value. "raw" attribute metrics edeaR (e.g. throughput_time) containing original data now kept applying group_by(). can useful analyses output metrics can accessed using attr(log, "raw"). Fixed bug add_start_activity() add_end_activity() failed applied activitylog. Fixed bug activitylog. Failed start complete columns available. Fixed bug assign_instance_id. Failed data column name status.

title: bupaR 0.5.1
text: CRAN release: 2022-09-29

title: bupaR 0.5.1
text: Added new functions check object x inherits particular event data class (.log(x), .eventlog(x), .activitylog(x), .grouped_log(x), .grouped_eventlog(x), .grouped_actiivtylog(x)).

title: bupaR 0.5.1
text: group_by(.data, ..., .add = F) now works correctly grouped_eventlog. Previously, applying group_by() grouped_eventlog reverted data.frame, prevented application bupaR functions returned value. "raw" attribute metrics edeaR (e.g. throughput_time) containing original data now kept applying group_by(). can useful analyses output metrics can accessed using attr(log, "raw"). Fixed bug add_start_activity() add_end_activity() failed applied activitylog. Fixed bug activitylog. Failed start complete columns available. Fixed bug assign_instance_id. Failed data column name status.

title: bupaR 0.5.1
text: Added NEWS.md file track changes package. Added GitHub Action (pkgdown). Updated README.md.
